subject: Politics
title: The Poverty Trap
description: Learn The Poverty Trap in one minute.

hook.text: Being poor is expensive. Bad credit means higher interest. No car means fewer jobs. Poverty traps people.

buildup.text: Poverty traps occur when conditions of poverty itself prevent escape: poor health, poor education, poor opportunity.

discovery.text: Randomized studies show that small cash transfers break poverty traps. The poor invest wisely when given the chance.

twist.text: Many anti-poverty programs require recipients to prove they're 'deserving.' The bureaucracy costs more than the aid.

climax.text: Universal basic income experiments show promising results. But political will for broad programs remains weak.

punchline.text: Poverty isn't a character flaw. It's a trap. The exit requires a ladder.

quiz.question: What does research show about giving cash to the poor?
options: They invest wisely and the transfers help break poverty traps
They always waste the money immediately
Cash transfers have no measurable effect
